intro: Lappula dzharkentica, commonly known as the Dzharkent lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in saline or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas effectively. Lappula dzharkentica plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation.
